thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: Trump says progress being made by all, after North Korea vows to stop nuclear tests

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Trump says progress being made by all, after North Korea vows to stop nuclear tests
text:
(Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday welcomed a statement by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un that he will suspend nuclear and missile tests immediately and abolish a nuclear test site, saying in a tweet: “Progress being made for all!”
U.S. President Donald Trump arrives at Naval Air Station Key West for a visit to the Joint Interagency Task Force South (JIATF South) federal anti-smuggling and anti-drug trafficking agency in Key West, Florida, U.S. April 19, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Trump earlier tweeted: “North Korea has agreed to suspend all Nuclear Tests and close up a major test site. This is very good news for North Korea and the World - big progress! Look forward to our Summit.”
Reporting by Brendan O'Brien in Milwaukee; Editing by Robert Birsel
Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.
